fields.summary: Allow for Timeline Calendar View to Zoom out further

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49377].
  {panel}

As a Confluence system administrator i want to have an administration interface where i can search and edit calendar permissions similar like the *restricted pages* interface in every space but globally for calendars.

h6. Situation
- You can't rename Confluence groups
- Due to team changes or consolidation you create a new group
- Check for old page / space permission and migrate to the new group
- You remove the old groups
- Colleagues can't access their existing restricted Team Calendars due to permission issues

h6. Workarround
* Go to the database and search for the old group names
{code:sql}SELECT * FROM ao_950dc3_tc_subcals_priv_grp WHERE GROUP_NAME = "yourgroup";{code}
* Copy the value of SUB_CALENDAR_ID
{code:title=Example}7984281f-a94d-471c-83c5-58686677df9e{code}

Because i'm not sure if it's safe to change these values in the datebase i do it in Confluence:
* Create a new page with the Team Calendars macro
* Embed an existing calendar
* Edit the source of the page with the copied value of SUB_CALENDAR_ID
* Safe the page and change the permissions

With this way i don't need to add all calendars to my calendar view.

An administration interface will make this a lot easier :)
fields.summary: Provide an administration interface to see and change restricted calendars
Ability to add individual dates created via // (date macro) to calendar
Allow certain fields to be set as mandatory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49373].
  {panel}

QA team have two calendars that are "Event" and "Leave". Now we want to merge both of them into one to manage more easier.

Workaround
* Edit each event then change their Calendar name one by one.
=> It takes much effort.

Expected
* Team Calendar should provide a function that allows user move all events from this Calendar to that Calendar
fields.summary: Merge two calendars into one
JIRA issue does not show in Confluence Team Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49368].
  {panel}

An event type what will iterate every time its repeated based on the assigned people to the event.

So if the setup would be something like this..

*Title:* Run updates
*Who:* Peter, John, Tim
*Repeat:* Weekly, once
*From/To:* Monday/Friday

Than it would look something like this:
{code}
week #1: mo - fri, Peter: Run updates
week #2: mo - fri, John: Run updates
week #3: mo - fri, Tim: Run updates
week #4: mo - fri, Peter: Run updates
...
{code}

But it should adjust itself automatically so, if you decide to add a person (Tom) to the bottom spot, after week 4 than it will look like this:
{code}
week #4: mo - fri, Peter: Run updates
week #5: mo - fri, John: Run updates
week #6: mo - fri, Tim: Run updates
week #7: mo - fri, Tom: Run updates
week #8: mo - fri, Peter: Run updates
...
{code}
fields.summary: Iteration event type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49367].
  {panel}

Ability to edit JIRA Project Releases events

h3. Summary

When using Team Calendars for Confluence integrated with JIRA, we are unable to edit the fields *When* and *Description* of JIRA Project Releases events. 

The purpose is to be able to edit its description and stipulate the hours the event will be scheduled. (e.g. 01/01/2015 12:00 - 01/01/2015 18:00).

It's important to notice the options are available if an event is manually entered in the calendar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a JIRA Project Releases event in JIRA.
# Go to Team Calendars for Confluence and see the event.
# Select *Edit*.
# Try to change the end-date or write down in *Description* field.

h3. Expected Results

# The checkbox _All day event_ may be grayed out.
# Description field does accept writing.
fields.summary: Ability to edit JIRA Project Releases events
Larger display required when clicking on calendar item

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

eg for a team leave calendar we had, event types such as: annual leave, sick, personal, time in lieu, maternity, etc
however when the calendar is exported to ical for automated processing and reporting the xml shows all these event types as "custom"
you have no idea which one is which
fields.summary: ical export of custom even types should have the event type. now they are all named "custom"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49357].
  {panel}

For the time being, the List view only shows the events within the next 30 days. In quite a few cases, we would like to see on one page all the events for one particular type of calendar/filter. For instance, I would to see all the leaves for a specific person as a list in a page.

So a non exhaustive list of options that are useful is:
* Select the max number of items to be shown on the list (with or without limit in time, and could be show all)
* Select a range of dates the list should show
* Select initial and final events between which the events should be listed
* Select a max number of days from today for which the events should be shown in the list (meaning choosing other that the imposed 30 days, could be no date, meaning show all)
fields.summary: More options on list view
Add group to the "Who" section when adding an event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49354].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If user create an event in behalf another user he will keep receiving the notification.

h3. Suggested Solution
Be able to select an owner when creating the event.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Change event owner

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49352].
  {panel}

The display of JIRA issue dates on a calendar is a very useful feature. But it is tantalizing because it comes so close to meeting our requirements and yet is still a few steps away.

We want to display JIRA issues as events, using "due date" or possibly some other JIRA date field, and we can do that now.

But we want to customize the JIRA fields that are visible in the event on the calendar. Currently we can see the issue key and the summary and that is frequently useful. But what we would like is the ability to choose what shows up in the "event cell", i.e., we might like to display the summary and the assignee, or, the summary and the component, etc. It also seems like we should be able to choose what shows in the cell under normal conditions, and, what shows during a hover.

I'm sure you already have this in the queue for a future release.

Thanks for the great product!
fields.summary: Super useful product could easily become exponentially more useful with ability to customize event display

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49349].

Chrome & Safari
!Chrome and Safari.png|thumbnail!

Firefox and IE
!firefox.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The last line of edit calendar popup does not show properly on firefox and IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49348].
  {panel}

When performing a backup of the space in Confluence, the procedure does not backup the calendars related to the space.

if the user removes the space, the calendar is also removed and the space backup does not restore this data, which is specially dangerous for unadvised users.

h4.Workaround.
We can [backup the calendars separately into ICS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/export-team-calendars-content-to-other-calendars-240913738.html] files and import them manually

h4. Possible Fix
Backup the team calendar information together with the space backup
fields.summary: Space backup does not backup the team calendar information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49347].
  {panel}

h5.Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence Team Calendars
# Create an event, give it a type of Travel
# Verify the sidebar now contains an item for "Travel" events
# Delete the event you just created - On a fresh install, there would now no longer be any travel events in the calendar

h5.Expected Result:
# "Travel" should be removed, as there are no travel events in the calendar.

h5.Actual Result
# "Travel" is still present even though there are no travel events.
# There is no feedback to suggest that there are no items that match that filter

h5.Impact
It would be nice if the sidebar was consistent with the contents of the calendar. It may also cause confusion if someone goes hunting for a travel event that doesn't exist.
fields.summary: The list of filters for a Calendar should be consistent with the contents of that Calendar
Ability to set multiple date reminders for one event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49344].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is no way to identify if a calendar was deleted. The only way is to check in the {{"AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS"}} table if the calendar still exists.

h3. Suggested Solution
When a calendar is deleted, it should be logged in Confluence logs. It should also include the username that triggered the deletion.
fields.summary: Improve Logging for Team Calendar Actions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49338].
  {panel}

One use case example:
- Each employee creates their personal calendar with PTO, Travel, etc. and adds a label such as "team-x"
- On "Team X" home page, a team calendar is present which shows all the calendars with the "team-x" label

With this feature, any new employee to the team simply adds the label "team-x" to their calendar and it is automatically added to the overall team page/calendar.

I think this sounds similar to TEAMCAL-700, but I wasn't sure so I wanted to document that particular use case.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Ability to add labels to calendars and then collect a group of calendars based on that label

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49323].
  {panel}

The exception {{com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.exception.CalendarException: calendar3.error.jiralink}} is only logged at a debug level. For troubleshooting reasons it would be good to have this logged at an error level.

Example of the stack trace:
{noformat}2015-02-26 06:27:39,460 DEBUG [http-bio-8443-exec-36762] [extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource] getResponseError Unable to load events of sub-calendar e293b0da-12e5-4ca6-8cfc-8a243362edf3
 -- url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | userName: eterekhov | referer: https://wiki.aligntech.com/calendar/mycalendar.action
com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.exception.CalendarException: calendar3.error.jiralink
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.AbstractJiraSubCalendarDataStore.getSubCalendarContentInternal(AbstractJiraSubCalendarDataStore.java:626)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.AbstractJiraSubCalendarDataStore.getSubCalendarContentInternal(AbstractJiraSubCalendarDataStore.java:72)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.ExternalCalendarDataStore.getSubCalendarContent(ExternalCalendarDataStore.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.getSubCalendarContentFromCalendarDataStore(CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:206)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.getSubCalendarContent(CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:154)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.findEvents(CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:510)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.getEvents(CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:469)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.DelegatingCalendarDataStore.getEvents(DelegatingCalendarDataStore.java:517)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore.getEvents(InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore.java:602)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore.getEvents(InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore.java:53)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.DelegatingCalendarDataStore.getEvents(DelegatingCalendarDataStore.java:517)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultCalendarManager.getEvents(DefaultCalendarManager.java:438)
...{noformat}
fields.summary: "CalendarException: calendar3.error.jiralink" only logged at DEBUG level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49322].
  {panel}

I often have need to refer to calendar events in Confluence pages.
It would be great if I could create a link to a specific event.

One possible method (I'm guessing the least amount of work):
 - Generate a link from the event like you do with pages
 - The user makes a hyperlink to refer to that event
 - Clicking on the event opens the calendar with that day/event highlighted

Another method (likely more work):
 - Have a macro that behaves something like the HTML <time> tag.
 - It looks like just an event name and date
 - Rollover gives event details as an infotip
 - Clicking brings you to the calendar with the event highlighted
fields.summary: Provide a method to link to a calendar event.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49319].
  {panel}

Label of event would be different according to the event state.
For exemple :
- canceled event is dashed
- reported event has arrows in the label
- past event is in grey
fields.summary: Customize event label according to state

To be able to plan events properly for our team we are missing an easy overview in availability.

It would help a lot to view/plot the amount of (available)people in a Team.
!image-2015-10-28-15-34-42-771.png|thumbnail! 

The image is an Excel example to clarify, showing that "Piet" and "Kees" are available

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49313].
  {panel}

Add some events.
Disable event types.
Events disappear from calendar.

Shouldn't these events remain, but perhaps with a default event type or something like "No event type selected"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49312].
  {panel}

Someone mistakenly deleted a calendar.  Confluence sent a notification stating it had been deleted and also included an .ics file.  I assumed this was an export of the calendar prior to deletion because the email mentioned importing the file to restore the calendar.

Unfortunately, the .ics file was empty, in other words it had no events in it.  When I imported it to Confluence the calendar was blank.  I imported it to Outlook at got a warning saying there were no events.

I searched Atlassian Answers and looked through the TEAMCAL project issues, but didn't find anything describing this exact problem.  Has it been addressed in a newer version?

If not, please fix the bug so that the file Confluence emails is an accurate export of the calendar data.

Many Thanks!
fields.summary: .ics file is empty when imported

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49311].
  {panel}

Probably not a super common case but I've created Team Cals but have now moved on from the team. There doesn't seem to be way for me to unsubscribe or change the "ownership" of the cals to someone else.

This means that the events of things I don't need to care about any more still appear on my Connie front page

*Reporter*: Chai
*E-mail*: [mailto:mark@atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Changing owners of Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49292].
  {panel}

Right now JIRA versions can be manifested only as single day event. It would be great if user could decide to show duration instead for all versions having both start and release date set.

This will help with:
* Planning - users can clearly see how much time they have
* Situation awareness - users may propose rescheduling, refactoring...whatever.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49281].
  {panel}

We've had users coming to us that really want the option to include more than one Related Page link when they are creating an event in Team Calendars. 

They want to be able to have their events linking to 2+ confluence pages rather than the default option of 1 Related Page. They use their team calendar events for displaying specs of promotions and also want to be able to add another link to a results page to give the event more historical meaning.

At the moment they are adding an extra link in the description field which doesn't aid ease of reading when describing the event nor does it render correctly (as per your open bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-997)

I envisage the option of clicking a + somewhere on the add event page to open additional Related Page fields where users can link through to other Confluence pages.

Please make it so!! :)
fields.summary: Add option to include more than one Related Page to a Team Calendar Event
Add SQL as datasource for Confluence Team Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hello,

I would like to know if there is a possibility to insert Outlook calendar in Team Calendar?
It is possible to insert iCal file for bank holidays, but this is not possible for iCal from Outlook.
Is there a workaround for this?

Regards,
Tamara

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49271].
  {panel}

At the moment, when pulling issues through from JIRA, it only displays:
 * Ticket ID
 * Summary

with no additional information, nor a way to pull the additional information in without going to the actual ticket. 

This means that when an engineer looks at the calendar event, it shows no useful information without going into JIRA.

Would there be a facility in which we can define fields to show in the Calendar itself?
fields.summary: Change Information shown in Team Calendars when Referencing JIRA Ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49269].
  {panel}

h5.Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Event
# Give the event a date in the future - For example, 1st January 2015.
# Set the event to repeat (any type of repeat is sufficient)
# Set the event to Repeat Until a certain date - 31st January 2015

h5.Expected Results
# The datepicker should default to at least the month my event starts in

h5.Actual Results
# The datepicker defaults to the current month

h5.Impact
This can be a pest if you're inputting dates long into the future, since you'll have to click through each month to get to at least the month you've created the event in.
fields.summary: The "Repeat Until" date field should use the event dates as a basis for it's starting date

fields.description:

Actual: this macro was not generated

!event macro.png!
fields.summary: Event macro in-line update doesn't include my data.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49266].
  {panel}
h3. *Suggestion*

Team Calendar should be able to point out any conflicting events in the calendar. 

h3. *Current State*

Right now if a calendar has conflicting events, there is no indication about it and the user has to manually observe the time slots and identify conflicts. 

This can be very handy, in situations where calendars are used for resource sharing, like meeting rooms reservations.
For example in the following snapshot, a calendar is being used by a team to share time slots for a meeting room.

 !Current.png|thumbnail! 

But the calendar doesn't give any warning for the user booking the room and will cause confusion at 11am on Monday. 

h3. *Proposal*

Team calendar should give indication that the event is conflicting. This indication can be anything like a small pop-up, warning the user when an overlapping event is created or as simple as something like following to highlight conflicting events.

 !Proposal.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Warning when Team Calendar has conflicting events
Option to Add a Custom Link to a JIRA Release Event Type in TC
Improve repeating calendar events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49261].
  {panel}

We are currently evaluating Team Calendar, and face the following problem:

* We are exporting a calendar to Outlook.
* The elements were displayed, when I have synchronized or imported a Calendar, but I don't see the type of event there. Is it possible to see the type of event? Is it possible to include the type of event in the title of an entry?

We need that functionality to differentiate the entries, e.g. to have the information if the employee is on a journey or on vacation. It is not possible all the time to have separate calendars for different event types, so the information about the event type should be visible in the export format.
fields.summary: Is it possible to configure display (include type)
Login & approve message doesn't really make sense - not sure why I would log in
Reminder text in event create should say the reminder time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49258].
  {panel}

I would like a view to see all Calendars, with these fields. This could be used by a admin or even a users to see what calendars are out there and who is the owner, etc. I see this as a critical feature for admins.

Calendar Name
Calendar Creator
Calendar Description
# of events (total)
# of subscribers
# possible list the event types and number of events
# possible list the permisisons
fields.summary: Ability to view a list of all calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49257].
  {panel}

Current behaviour
# Create a new event
# Select Leave event type then input all required items
# Select Birthday
* => The repeat field shows Yearly (It's OK)
# Select other event types such as Travel 
* => The repeat field still shows Yearly (It's not good, users usually change to do not repeat)

Expected
* => The repeat field should show "Do not repeat" (the recent value of Travel)
fields.summary: [Create an event] it should keep recent values of others when switch to birthday
As an administrator I would like invalid JQL to be logged as WARN or INFO rather than ERROR

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49255].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if two users edit the same event on a Team Calendar and save it at the same time, Confluence will save only the changes done by one of the users.

h3. Suggested Solution
We could provide a way to resolve this by either locking other users from editing when a user is editing a Calendar automatically, or we could provide a 'lock' for users to be able to lock Calendars before editing them.
 
h3. Workaround 
Manually lock this Calendar down by editing the restrictions. This can be cumbersome especially for Calendars with many permissions:
# Go to the calendar
# Restrict the calendar only to that single user
# Edit/add any events
# Remove restrictions
fields.summary: Extend restrictions in Team Calendars to allow only one user to edit at a time
Increase event reminder options for Team Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49253].

h3.Steps 

 # Navigate to a space's "PSRV" Calendar, ex https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/PSRV/calendars#
 # Click Add Event
 # Select Start and End dates and notice that the end date can't change

 *What happened...* 
Nothing...

 *What should have happened...*
The date should change to what was selected in the calendar widget.
fields.summary: Can't Select Dates in Space Calendar "Add Event"
